facts.fact_text: Bitcoin plunged toward $62,000 in early February, hitting its lowest levels since October 2024.

facts.fact_text: Bitcoin has now lost about half its value from its October 2025 peak.

evidences.evidence_text: The leading cryptocurrency has now lost about half its value from its October 2025 peak

claims.claim_text: Some analysts argue that bitcoin has been exposed as a largely speculative asset, failing to function as a debasement hedge comparable to gold and other precious metals.
claims.author: analysts

evidences.evidence_text: Some analysts argue that bitcoin has been exposed as a largely speculative asset, failing to function as a debasement hedge comparable to gold and other precious metals.

claims.claim_text: The latest drop puts long-term bitcoin holders to the test amid mounting doubts about digital assets’ real-world utility.

evidences.evidence_text: The latest drop puts long-term bitcoin holders to the test amid mounting doubts about digital assets’ real-world utility.

evidence.evidence_text: Bitcoin Tumbles to 17-Month Low Bitcoin plunged toward $62,000 in early February, hitting its lowest levels since October 2024 as the market continued to flush out leveraged traders amid a broad selloff across financial markets.
Investor optimism had previously been buoyed by Trump’s direct involvement in the sector and his pledges to ease regulation, priming to make the US the “crypto capital of the world.”
